channel.title: Auto News | Latest Automobiles & Auto Industry Information and Updates: ET Auto : ETAuto.com
channel.description: Find the latest automobile Auto Insight, News & Articles from all top sources for the Indian Auto industry on ET Auto.

image.title: Auto News | Latest Automobiles & Auto Industry Information and Updates: ET Auto : ETAuto.com

item.title: Gadkari asks state FM's to consider reducing GST on flex-fuel vehicles to 12 %
item.description: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari urged state finance ministers to reduce GST on flex-fuel vehicles to 12%. He emphasized the need to cut fossil fuel imports and boost biofuel use. Currently, GST rates stand at 28% for combustion engine vehicles and 5 percent for electric ones, Gadkari highlighted the potential benefits for agriculture and job creation.

item.title: Air taxis to rule skies soon, revolutionise urban travel
item.description: India is set to become the largest market for electric air taxis by 2026, as announced by Nikhil Goel of Archer Aviation. Archer plans to launch its Midnight air taxi in collaboration with InterGlobe Enterprises, aiming to revolutionize urban travel. The US firm is working with local regulators to develop policies and infrastructure.

item.title: Vjaitra Air Mobility teams with Trouvé Innovation Hub for hydrogen air taxi prototype
item.description: Vjaitra Air Mobility's collaboration with Trouvé Innovation Hub Inc. will facilitate the creation of a full-scale prototype of the hydrogen air taxi. The air taxis, capable of covering distances up to 600 km, are designed to offer quieter flights, zero emissions, and reduced operating costs compared to conventional aircraft.

item.title: BiUP.ai secures Pre-Series A investment from Girnar Vision Fund for next-gen mobility Solutions
item.description: BiUP Technologies, an AI-led Immersive Tech SaaS company, has received a strategic investment from CarDekho Group's Girnar Vision Fund. This Pre-Series A funding will help BiUP enhance its technology and expand in India and globally, focusing on revolutionising customer experiences in the mobility sector with AI-driven solutions.

item.title: Electric vehicle battery of the future: Govt & private sector must focus on Na-ion technology
item.description: Electronics industry uses Na-ion batteries in abundance while grid power storage uses this on account of cost benefit and safety. Research is going on in various laboratories all over the world to pack more energy per unit weight.

item.title: Hyundai unveils new Alcazar SUV with advanced tech features, including NFC Digital Key and enhanced connectivity
item.description: Hyundai Motor India Limited has unveiled the new HyundaiAlcazar, a premium 6 and 7 seater SUV with advanced technology features. The SUV includes a Digital Key with NFC, over 70 connected car features, Dual Zone Automatic Climate Control, and 270+ voice commands, offering enhanced safety, comfort, and connectivity for an improved driving experience.

item.title: Uber invests in UK startup Wayve to speed up self-driving projects
item.description: Among the main challenges is that self-driving software systems have lacked humans' ability to predict and assess risk quickly, especially when encountering unexpected incidents or "edge cases" where autonomous vehicles get stuck because they cannot work out what to do.

item.title: Govt scraps GPS tracker fee for public vehicle owners
item.description: The Delhi government has exempted commercial passenger vehicle owners from paying the annual fee for vehicle location tracking devices. This move, benefiting approximately 1.5 lakh public vehicle owners, aims to reduce their financial burden while enhancing passenger safety. The National Informatics Centre will now handle real-time vehicle tracking and monitoring using these devices.

item.title: Prawaas 4.0: Tata Motors demonstrates safe, smart and sustainable mass mobility solutions
item.description: Tata Motors showcased its latest mass mobility solutions at Prawaas 4.0, including the new Tata Ultra EV 7M electric bus. Featuring zero emissions, advanced safety features, and fast charging, the bus is designed for urban environments. Tata Motors continues to lead in sustainable transport with various electric, CNG, and alternative fuel vehicles.

item.title: Veera Vahana and Exponent Energy unveil world's first 15-minute charging intercity electric bus - Veera Mahasamrat EV
item.description: Veera Vahana has collaborated with Exponent Energy to introduce the world's first 15-minute charging intercity bus, the Veera Mahasamrat EV. Equipped with a 320 kWh battery, it offers a sustainable alternative to diesel buses on long routes. The initiative begins on the Bengaluru-Hyderabad route with four 1 MW charging stations.

item.title: Ashok Leyland unveils GARUD 15M: India's first front engine multi-axle bus chassis
item.description: Ashok Leyland, the flagship of the Hinduja Group, has introduced India’s first front engine multi-axle bus chassis, GARUD 15M, at Prawaas 4.0. Designed for long-distance travel, it features 42 sleeper berths, the highest GVW in its category, and advanced comfort and safety features. Commercial launch is set for Q4 FY25.

item.title: Varroc appoints Dr. Karl-Heinz Glander as Head of R&D for Business II
item.description: Varroc has appointed Dr. Karl-Heinz Glander as the Head of R&D for Business II. Dr. Glander, based in Germany, will oversee the development of advanced automotive technologies such as ADAS and DMS. His role aims to strengthen Varroc's innovation and competitive edge. He brings 20 years of experience in the automotive sector.

item.title: Questions about the safety of Tesla's 'Full Self-Driving' system are growing
item.description: Tesla's "Full Self-Driving" system is under scrutiny following incidents where the technology performed unsafe maneuvers. Analyst William Stein's tests found the system lacking, and a fatal crash in Seattle has raised further concerns. Federal regulators are investigating the safety of Tesla's automated driving systems.

item.title: Ather Energy collaborates with Google to provide real-time EV charging station information
item.description: Ather Energy has partnered with Google to provide real-time information on fast-charging stations for electric two-wheelers in India. Users can now find Ather Grid chargers on Google Maps with live status updates, improving the convenience of charging and promoting wider adoption of electric vehicles in the country.

item.title: Encouraging only a single tech not the right strategy for India: Maruti Suzuki Chairman R C Bhargava
item.description: Maruti Suzuki Chairman RC Bhargava, at the company's 43rd annual general meeting, emphasised the need for various fuel technologies to meet India's Net Carbon Zero Emission target. Maruti Suzuki is focusing on hybrids, CNG, biogas, and hydrogen fuel while planning to launch its first EV model soon and significantly expand exports by 2030.

item.title: Volvo is sticking with Uber to win the autonomous driving 'marathon'
item.description: One of Volvo's partners in the development of next generation autonomous technology is Uber. However, the controversial tech firm's efforts have been beset by development issues including the crash of an autonomous XC90 test car in Arizona.

item.title: VECV signs MoU for deployment of 500 Eicher Pro 6055 LNG trucks with Baidyanath LNG
item.description: VE Commercial Vehicles Limited, a Volvo and Eicher Motors JV, signed an agreement to launch 500 Eicher Pro 6055 LNG trucks with Baidyanath LNG. Inaugurated by Minister Nitin Gadkari, these trucks offer advanced engine technology, impressive fuel efficiency, and real-time performance insights, promoting the use of cleaner fuel in long-haul transport.

item.title: China's BYD to use Huawei's advanced autonomous driving system in off-road EVs
item.description: The tie-up follows BYD's efforts to move upscale as it aims to increase the sales of its premium brands of Denza, Fangchengbao and Yangwang to improve profitability. The three brands accounted for just 5% of its total sales in the first half, according to data from China Association of Automobile Manufacturers.

item.title: We should have the ability to create crucial technologies on our own: MeitY Secretary
item.description: Hykon India Ltd., in collaboration with C-DAC (T), launched Hybrid Power Conditioning Systems for Microgrids. These systems, developed under the NaMPET programme, offer resilient industrial microgrid solutions with robust hardware, advanced cooling systems, and grid synchronisation features.

item.title: China's Didi in talks to sell smart auto assets to state-backed NavInfo's unit
item.description: Didi sold its EV development business to Chinese EV maker Xpeng a year ago in a deal worth USD 744 million in exchange for a roughly 3.25% stake in the vehicle maker. That accounted for the bulk of its EV-related assets, said the three sources.
